config.question: Which of the following would have been one of the consequences of Lincoln’s failure to issue the Emancipation Proclamation?

choices.content: The Republican party would have been divided and the Union government would have been in jeopardy.
The upper South states of Kentucky, Delaware, West Virginia, and Maryland would have seceded from the Union.
Britain and France might have refrained from extending their support to the Union cause.
Those slaves who were rescued from southern farms would have inundated the Midwest and impoverished the northern economy.

answer_3.response: Consider This: Most Republican politicians were now committed to emancipation, and many were on the verge of repudiating the administration for its inaction. See L.O. 15.3 How did the Union finally attain victory, and what role did emancipation play in it?
